title: Welcome
text: A short intro to your site. Use the navbar to reach the blog and about pages.

title: About
text:
CAKE
I have studied the use of antidiabetic drugs, or their utilisation, in Denmark, as part of my Ph.D. The main sources I worked with during the Ph.D. were registry data from The Register of Pharmaceutical Sales and The National Patient Register.
This blog is dedicated to showcasing my skills as a data scientist with an understanding of health economics, epidemiology and medicine.
Using words inspired by the R for Data Science, I will do the following:

Import datasets from different sources
Transforming/wrangling data
Visualise the data
Make basic statistical models
Interpret and communicate the results

Hopefully, and perhaps most importantly, perform these things with scientific rigour and examining hypothesis and assumptions underlying the data
All of this using the lovely tool made available by the Quarto toolbox funded by Posit. I do this because I am thoroughly interested in data analysis and interpretation, and because I love playing detective and figuring stuff out.
